title: FS/FT>>>1907 H.M. Taylor Ty Cobb At Bat Postcard SGC 1-Postmarked Oct 12th, 1907
author: investinrookies

posts.post_title: FS/FT>>>1907 H.M. Taylor Ty Cobb At Bat Postcard SGC 1-Postmarked Oct 12th, 1907

posts.post_content:
Sent to PWCC weekly Sunday auction due to no interest here, ends tommorrow night.  


Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk
Is there a price on this?
I know its not normal practice to disclose private sale prices but I cant seem to find the auction results. What did it go for?  Sorry I missed out.....

[quote name="ullmandds" post=2304822]8400+[/QUOTE]

Seems low. I wonder if the seller, and their issues, had anything to do with it?

.

[quote name="Leon" post=2304836]Seems low. I wonder if the seller, and their issues, had anything to do with it?

.[/QUOTE]

Same exact card sold in Heritage in August 2022 for $11,700.  So not a good result.  

I assume that by "seller", you mean PWCC?  If so, I doubt their issues had much to do with it.  Rather, I just don't think PWCC is a good AH for this type of product.  I look at PWCC's weekly auction every week and their premier auction every time it opens -- as a prewar collector, I rarely find anything to bid on, and I have not bought anything from PWCC since they went off ebay.  PWCC, like Goldin, appear to be a prime source of modern stuff.  This card likely would have done much better in Heritage, REA, LOTG, Memory Lane, Mile High, Sterling, etc.  The card pictured above is a good looking example and someone got a great deal, I think

+1 agree and well said
